"I trust you had no trouble finding the place?"

Sighing, Arkemyr glances up from a roll of parchment. He takes up a quill and draws several lines across a calendar entry - digging the nib hard enough that scratching fills the silence.
"Yes?"
"What can I do for you?"
"My estate was recently burgled, my vault breached." He sighs, drawing a sheaf of papers closer and then pushing them away.
"Your robes - how alike they are to one I keep in my chambers." His eyes narrow to pinpricks.
"Your companion's robes - so similar to my own. How fascinating." His eyes narrow to pinpricks.

"The Circle of Archmagi wishes for us to put this 'unpleasantness' in the past with a gesture of 'good faith.'" 

When he finishes his air quotes, his elbow knocks over an inkwell. Arkemyr simply glares at the spilled ink until it retreats back into its receptacle.
"Believe me, I'm looking forward to getting out of them." Aloth wrinkles his nose, plucking at the stiff fabric.
"You got no proof. That giant 'A' on the breast could stand for a lot of things."
"I've worn secondhand uniforms that breathed better than this."
"I am as disturbed as you."
"Were a tad long in the legs, sure, but I be more than half-handy with a pair of shears."

"This old thing? I've worn it for ages."

Grinning ear to ear, Xoti gives him her best curtsy.

"Won't someone help me remove them?" 

He raises his arms in protest of the stifling cloth.
"Again, fascinating." He swivels his gaze back to you.

"I warn you to stay your hand and treat with me better than you did poor Concelhaut." 

He pauses to study your reaction with interest.

"I had my reservations about this meeting when I learned the fate of poor Llengrath." 

He pauses to study your reaction with interest.
"Llengrath... gone as well. Your dealings with the Circle are stained darkest crimson."
"I'm just here to talk."
"The next Llengrath will know better than to cross me."
[Say nothing.]
"As you say."
"But let us get to the business of the hour, shall we?" He opens his palms.
"One hopes that Rauatai knows how to properly archive the Harapo Epic."
"I am less pleased about the Harapo Epic resting in the hands of those who lost it once before."
"I have questions about you, Arkemyr."
"Why did you settle down in Neketaka?"
"Farewell."
He calmly gestures for you to continue.
"Why indeed. The Circle is invested in the region, and someone must oversee it all at once."
"I drew the short straw for this unfortunate decade."
"Why did you bind imps into servitude?"
"Their antics amuse me, and I have no patience for the shortcomings of supposedly intelligent kith."
"Next question."
"Back to my previous questions."
"More? Speak on, then."
"I thought you should know that Fassina gave me the key to your manor."
"Did she, now?" He sets down his quill and steeples his fingers.
"Noted." The finality of that syllable send a chill through the room.
"Rather than waste our time with pleasantries, let us get to the business of the hour."
"Tell me about yourself."
"I am a member of the Circle of Archmagi, for better or worse." He sniffs.
"And yet I had to open a shop to make up the exorbitant cost of relocating my estate across the known world."
"Do you know anything about the Sanguine Harvest?"
"Curious. An explorer named Ceulia made a similar inquiry some tens of seasons ago." Arkemyr narrows his eyes.
"There may be a book on the matter in my basement. I trust you can show yourself downstairs. Again."
"If you require directions to Bekarna's observatory, look to your sextant." Arkemyr gestures for you to speak freely.
"I'll let you know when I've found anything."

"Neketaka is either a testament to the ancient Huana's love of labyrinths or their hatred of straight lines." 

He grimaces and rearranges several of the objects situated around his desk.
[Bow] "Thank you for the invitation, Arkemyr."
"Maybe it was designed to annoy meddlesome outsiders."
"Age, not the Huana, has set the bones of the city at crooked angles."
[Say nothing.]
"Try not to get too comfortable."
He blinks once, twice. A smile slowly begins to overtake his expression. It dies just as gradually.
"Straight to the point, then."
"Sadly, I did not invite you here for a discussion of city planning."
"Can we get to the point?"
"That depends entirely on you."
"Naturally, Arkemyr."
"Concelhaut didn't give me much of a choice."
[Say nothing.]
Sighing, he raps his knuckles on the top of his desk.
"I didn't come here to fight."
"They say after I kill a third archmage the fourth is free."
[Say nothing.]
"I wonder."
"I know. I was the one who burgled it."
"That's terrible... do you have any leads?"
[Lie] "I'd be happy to track down the culprits for you."
[Say nothing.]
"You managed not to rouse a peep out of my servants. If nothing else, the lack of disruption is... appreciated."
"If you imagine that imp blood is easy to remove from carpet, I invite you to clean up after yourself."
"I daresay you awoke the whole neighborhood with the shrieking of my imps."
"As I suspected."
"How very pleasing to hear an honest admission."
"One." The side of his mouth twitches.
"This will go better for you if you don't insult my intelligence."
"Go on."
"Want me to steal the Harapo Epic back?"
[Say nothing.]
"An amusing project... but no."
"The Circle has expressed concerns about a certain mobile deity."
"The Deadfire is a fragile place, and a blundering soul-drain like Eothas can damage more than just castle keeps."
"I'm already tracking Eothas, if that's your concern."
"Such as?"
"The Deadfire will be lucky if any of its reefs endure this long walk of his."
[Say nothing.]
"It isn't our desire that you apprehend the deity. That simply isn't practical."

"We need your help in preparing for the... worst possible outcome." 

Arkemyr presses his thumb down on a spider crawling across his desk. His upper lip pulls back with delight.
"The wizard Bekarna installed an observatory due northeast of Neketaka. For your 'absolution,' the Circle asks that you locate her research."
"What are you hoping to learn from the stars?"
"Why ask me and not Bekarna?"
"I'll get your research notes."
"I'll think about it."
"Use a modicum of your imagination."
"Indeed."
"And a household staff to replenish." He bites his lower lip and narrows his eyes at you.
"And several upset neighbors to quell." Sighing, Arkemyr presses his temple and banishes you with a wave.
"That the Circle's... concerns are utterly unfounded, of course." His eyebrow arches up.
"No doubt you'll recognize the appropriate documents. You have an eye for valuables."
"She vanished from academic research and therefore her livelihood."
"All signs point to her lab being abandoned."

"Fair warning. A vessel flying the sigil of the Torn Bannermen set a course for the observatory."

Frowning, Arkemyr sifts among his correspondence until he sets upon the one he seeks.
"I'll keep that in mind."
[Say nothing.]
"How could you possibly know this?"
"Come back alive or not at all. Now if you don't mind, I have a manor to restore."
"The Deadfire has many eyes. I would have thought a Watcher knew this already?"
"I know that standard. Hired muscle, the expensive kind."
"I have every reason to believe that they travel armed."
"In the hands of its rightful owners, you mean."
"You had no lawful right to it."
[Say nothing.]
"It's their cultural history as much as the Huana's."
"They need to finance this campaign somehow."
"As long as I'm compensated for the work."
"Were the spoils of my estate too meager? Absolutely not." His brow furrows.
"At the Circle's behest, I am expected to show restraint in these dealings." His nails dig into the armrest of his chair. A tearing sound fills the silence between you.
"Did I ask a question?" Arkemyr glances to the left and right. He waits before continuing.
"And a security system to reevaluate." He frowns toward the door before turning his focus back to his desk.
"I had other questions."
Clearing his throat, Arkemyr simply waits.
"Do so. You know how I enjoy our little chats." He shakes his head.
"Bekarna? I found this old almanac in an orrery. Look familiar?"
"You did, did you? That does rather defeat the purpose of absolution." Arkemyr tugs on his lower lip and scrutinizes you.
"So be it! Follow me down to the scrying pool."
Arkemyr's eyes are closed in deep concentration, his attention entirely focused on the glowing pool in front of him.
"This isn't just restitution. The Circle is worried."
[Say nothing.]
"Give me the details."
"What can I accomplish that you can't?"

"Normally, the Circle's involvement constitutes the 'worst possible outcome.'

"Or have you already forgotten the Blackwash Falls incident?" Aloth watches Arkemyr through narrowed eyes.

"Kalakoth replaced the water. What more do you desire, an apology?" 

Arkemyr turns his nose up at Aloth.
"Psh. We do not worry. We measure, and the resulting value dictates action."
"We..." Arkemyr stops himself, his fingers splayed on the desk in the midst of a fidget.
"You are only involved because it is advantageous for knowledge of the Circle's involvement to remain discreet."
"They're elite mercenaries. We faced off at the siege of Cr√§gholdt."
"Did I inquire after your personal history?" Arkemyr sneezes into his sleeve and grimaces.
"My interest begins and ends at a single point - that someone of great means desires abandoned arcane research."
"Research which we... disregarded." He clears his throat and glances away.
"Torn Bannermen?"
"Mercenaries, I suspect. Expensive ones if they take such pains to advertise their standard." He waves at the air as if to dispel flies.

"Fassina. Here. Uninvited.

"I take it you've moved on from apprenticeship to... other pursuits?" Arkemyr unsteeples his fingers to wave dismissively in your direction.
Her eyes narrow until she's staring through a razor-thin slit. Fassina slowly nods.
"Excellent." He flips open a ledger and scribbles a small check mark next to an entry before snapping it shut and shifting his attention over to you.
"These old things? Allow me to explain..."
"They're very comfortable."
[Say nothing.]
"Don't. Even. Bother."
"Indeed."
